@Version(value="1.0.0")

Package uk.co.strangeskies.utilities

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Copyable<S extends Copyable<S>>
    An object which can be copied.
    DeepCopyable<S extends DeepCopyable<S>>
    An object which can be copied.
    Described
    An interface to provides a canonical description for an object.
    ForwardingListener.Buffer<T,U>
    An interface for provision of a buffering strategy.
    Isomorphism.IsomorphismProxy
    Marker interface for proxies created by Isomorphism.
    Log
    A log interface for clients to write events to.
    Named
    An interface to provides a canonical name for an object.
    Observable<M>
    Simple interface for an observable object, with methods to add and remove observers expecting the applicable type of message.
    ObservableProperty<T extends R,R>
    A property which is observable as per ObservableValue, and whose value can also be set.
    ObservableValue<T>
    A value which can be fetched and observed for updates and changes.
    ObservableValue.Change<T>
    A value change event.
    Property<T extends R,R>
    This interface represents a gettable and settable property of a given type.
    Scoped<T extends Self<T>>
    A general interface describing a system with a hierarchical scope for visibility of the contents of that system.
    Self<S extends Self<S>>
    For classes which follow the self-bounding pattern.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AggregatingListener<T>
    An implementation of ForwardingListener which aggregates consumed data into a list, then provides it to listeners in chunks of all remaining data.
    BufferingListener<T>
    An implementation of ForwardingListener which simply pipes event objects to chained listeners asynchronously with the original event thread.
    ConsumerSupplierQueue<T>
    A buffer to decouple the delivery of events with their sequential consumption, such that events consumed will be queued for later supply.
    Enumeration<S extends Enumeration<S>>
    A reimplementation of Java's Enum class, primarily for the purpose of facilitating enumerations with generics.
    EquivalenceComparator<T>
    Provides an arbitrary total ordering over a type of object from an equality relation.
    ForwardingListener<T,U>
    A buffer to decouple the delivery of events with their sequential consumption, such that the event firing threads are not blocked by listeners.
    IdentityProperty<T>
    A basic implementation of Property which simple stores it's value as a member variable, which can be updated and retrieved through get and set.
    Isomorphism
    An isomorphic mapping from one object graph to another, typically maintained during a set of deep copy operations.
    LatestListener<T>
    An implementation of ForwardingListener which pipes the latest available event objects to listeners as quickly as they can keep up with production.
    Observable.TerminatingObserver<M>
    A terminating observer is one which may easily conditionally remove itself from an observable upon receipt of an event.
    Observable.WeakObserver<M,O>
    A weak observer is one which automatically removes itself from an observable once it is otherwise available for garbage collection.
    ObservableImpl<M>
    A simple implementation of Observable which maintains a list of listeners to receive events fired with ObservableImpl.fire(Object).
    ObservablePropertyImpl<T extends R,R>
    A simple implementation of ObservableProperty which maintains a list of listeners to receive change events fired with ObservablePropertyImpl.set(Object).
    PropertySet<T>
    This class identifies a set of properties relating to a certain class, such that they can be used to more easily implement hash code generation and equality testing.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Log.Level
    The level of importance of a log entry.
